Reason: The configuration option _journalSizeThreshold is performance-sensitive. This is because the value of _journalSizeThreshold directly affects the creation of a PersistentJournal object, which involves time-expensive and memory-expensive operations such as disk I/O and memory allocation. The size of the journal can have a significant impact on the performance of the system, especially in terms of disk usage and processing time. Therefore, any changes to _journalSizeThreshold can lead to notable performance variations at the system level.
